comments.body: What do you mean by "what??"
Maybe they freeze to a statue block until warmed up (you could only mine statues with silk touch)
Maybe they can turn blue gradually before death
I think it's a good idea but it would make getting off of a strider very difficult, since you would have to get off of them in lava.
Good idea

So essentially if they are out of lava for too long they will begin taking damage over time due to them being too cold. Some things could help slow this process such as walking through fire, or campfires.
Let's say possibly 3 minutes until they begin to take damage out of lava.
Here is a picture of it in-game using data packs! This dude is charging up his big fireball attack, which means its time to split!
maybe also only allowed to be on soul sand/soil?
Love this idea. It's like a Soul Sand magma cube!
Perfect I love it!
another food source in the nether sounds like a great idea, do you think you'd cook the calamari tho?
That’s a good idea, I didn’t even think about that. Maybe the tentacles would just drop themselves, and then you could cook it to get the calamari.
Great idea, the warped forest has a lot of potential for new mobs and would love to see some cool stuff like this. Voted
This definitely gets my vote!
Intresting idea. Not sure about the whole Chrous theme but Arrows that teleport you would be fun!

This would be so cool! My suggestions are:

  • I think they would have to only spawn occasionally because it would be so annoying to be teleported around by 5 chorus skeletons. 
  • The Chrous Skeleton could have a really interesting model with a big head and maybe a particle effect.
  • You would be able to pick up its bow, which would teleport players and mobs away when you shoot them. This would be useful if a creeper was chasing you, for example, as you could shoot it away as it was exploding and it would explode in the distance. 

Love the idea!
TheVendettaMan. Thanks for the suggestions! I thought they were good ideas, and decided to include them.
A skeleton with chorus stuff on it’s arm perhaps?
What if instead of a chorus bow, it dropped chorus stalks, and four chorus stalks could be crafted into a chorus stem?
I think that it should drop a new arrow instead of a bow. It would be called the Chorus Arrow.
Your right it’s annoying if your animal such as horse gets hurt it is stuck that way
I agree, my fox friend keeps getting hurt in survival when I'm hunting hostile mobs in forests. This would definitely be helpful.
Cute. Maybe instead of jumping, they very aggressively boop them, inflicting high knockback and killing them.
Yes please

Solid idea. Creepers could really use some variation, and this one sounds good.
me encanta la idea

I was just about to share this idea when I found your post.
That’d be funny! Imagine a wolf having a piece of mutton in their mouth
I actually like this... and it makes sense...  However, as for other items, there should be some differences in terms of what items a fox will pick up as opposed to what items a wolf will pick up...
They’re not that hard to deal with, especially if you have a shield.
i just hate how the walk away from u and if your too far away they like spint

I agree, they're incredibly OP now, especially in the Nether. I was okay with them before this update, but now they're so common in the Nether I'm getting groups of 5-6 of them every 3 steps I take, and they annihilate my shield before I can do anything. Their knockback is through the roof, and when I'm encountering these groups I cannot do anything, they're hitting me back and the shots are out of sync, it's literally impossible to get past. They've made the Skeletons far too strong. I play hard mode, but nothing changes on easy mode, they're still OP. I think the knockback should be lowered, at least. And their draw time is insane, an arrow:1 second. The spawn "weight" (chance of spawn) in soul sand valleys was raised from two to TEN. I genuinely cannot enjoy the Nether update because I can't get anywhere from how many there are.

Yeah even in 1.20 they’re super op and when I’m mining for netherite they spawn in the mine and large groups of them too, and they destroy my shield extremely quickly, they have no reason to spawn this much
If you have no armor and low hearts for some reason it feels like the CPU turns on Aim Bot
Playing in August, 2024. Skeletons are still way too OP. Reaction time, accuracy, and fire rate all need to be nerfed.
I love this idea! It brings even more reasons to go to the woodland mansion and defeat the Wither! Also Minecraft hasn’t had a new boss for a while so this would be a great boss! Good idea bro
This is really cool.
I can see it in my head it's really cool
The crown could be repaired by using gold, diamonds.
i wish i thought of this it would be cool to have a new boss and its an over world boss minecraft never had that it only had the wither witch is a nether boss and the ender dragon witch is in the end
happy face

Actually a good idea, it will represent the Minecraft Dungeons where normally Evoker is a mini-boss but in Minecraft Dungeons Arcade, there is a boss version of Evoker. The Evoker in Woodland Mansion will be a Boss meanwhile Evokers in Raid will serve as a normally strong Illager.
Fun idea

I like the idea of having hornets in contrast to bees. I was gonna suggest this so I'll leave my support here. Anyway, perhaps Hornets should be hostile to all entities, even monsters, because hornets are just jerks and are an enemy to all.

I think they should also spawn in the savan. Also those who are in the savana and junglr should have a blue color and would inflict poison (blue becouse it would look like the blue mud dauber wasp). Also they could be bred with sugar
I think that brewing the stingers would make a "Potion of Venom" so you inflict poison on the mob you hit with ur sword, fist or any tool

Cassowaries are native to the humid rainforest of New Guinea, nearby smaller islands, East Nusa Tenggara, The Maluku Islands and to northeastern Australia. They will, however, venture out into palm scrub, grasslands, savanna, and swamp forest.

YES. However, feeding them shouldn't make them attack you. I think getting within 2 blocks, hitting them, approaching one with a chick, or potential random outbursts (though rare) should be when they attack you. They would be a little smaller than ostriches, with less health. Cassowaries can kill you with one kick, so I would give them a damage output of 14 easy, 17 normal, and 20 hard. If they attack you from random outbursts or being too close, they will strike once before running off a small distance and losing hostility. If they have a chick or you attack them, they will keep attacking until you die or escape. Chicks would be passive, but if you hit them they will run away and find an adult (if one is nearby). Adult cassowaries only drop 2-3 feathers, but if you shear them you can collect 4-5, though they may become hostile from this (similar to getting too close). You can feed them most fruits (apples, sweet and glow berries, new fruits being potentially added?), but no cocoa. They should be found in Giant Tree Jungles, as these are thicker with vegetation. If you feed them, they regenerate their feathers. When moving, they walk as fast as a sheep, slower when sheared, but when angry, they will sprint as fast as a baby zombie, though slower if sheared. They cannot float off edges like a chicken can, but they are smart enough to not walk through lava, cacti, or off cliffs.
The Guardian is the aquatic boss
But it's not even that difficult and fun, unlike the Ender dragon or Wither.
Like the Loch Ness ?
真心觉得不错。生物行为真的是太迟钝了。我觉得动物们应该自主避开人类。并且应该在非和平模式下有反击能力。如果是这样的话那就太真实了。棒

I think this is a great idea, as it would make the bane of arthropods enchantment much more useful. It could also split into multiple centipedes when attacked in the middle, like the the classic arcade game.
this sounds just like what I have been looking for. I just hope that someone can make an add-on version of this, lol. I love this idea.

I was also thinking about new arthropod mob, so the enchantment would gain more use. 
Although i had ranged-poison scorpion in my mind. Or Bombardier Beetle that would throw fireballs at player Idk. Bane of Arthropods is totally useless.
Maybe like house centipedes as well could be added too.
What if the centipede could climb walls like the spider and when killed the centipede could drop a centipede leg. These centipede legs could be used to make a climbing potion.

NO. Spiders are terrifying enough as it is, se don't need a herder version. I agree that bane of the arthropods is not extremely useful, but add a new monster like a scorpion or a rhino beetle, not a centipede.
They are already scared on Bedrock Edition, I don't know for Java

Absolutely.  It's really frustrating when making sheep pens that they eat the grass constantly too.  The babies should also not eat the grass, since they don't make any use of it.

I like how they can go through walls, but I think they're damage and speed should be nerfed, I mean, how fast and strong can some demon ghost ferries be?

He must not use a sword. He must have two states: ethereal (for passing through walls and invulnerability to physical attacks) and material (physically vulnerable, but he himself can deal damage). Claws, or a stinger, or a scorpion tail will suit him.
i love this idea. This could also fit will with an end variant that a chorus plant. it would be cool if it spawned naturally as well

Creaking Variant
If you place a creaking heart between two logs that are not pale oak logs, the heart will not work. However, the heart should change color to match the type of log and summon a creaking of the same color as the log. The creaking should defend the player from hostile mobs. The time of day when it appears is the same as for the regular version of the creaking.

To use such a creaking continuously, it needs to be named. This way, it will defend you both at night and during the day. This is an idea intended to replace the iron golem.
